name: Lang Park
description:
California town now requiring quiet paddles at public pickleball courts
Apr 10 2025
Pickleball players who play at Lang Park in Laguna Beach, California, will be required to use "quiet" paddles going forward after the city council there passed a law that fines people for using the louder traditional paddles.

The Police Department’s Park Rangers will enforce the new law, city officials said.

The city council took action after several years of complaints from residents of a nearby senior community, according to The Orange County Register.

In 2023, the city installed sound barriers around the courts, which were tennis courts originally and were converted to pickleball as the sport gained popularity. That apparently didn't solve the problem, as complaints continued, resulting in the city also limiting hours at the park -- no play is allowed on Mondays or in the afternoon on Tuesdays and Thursdays.
open_play_schedule: WE'RE GIVING AWAY 15 NEW ADIDAS PADDLES THIS WEEK! ENTER HERE! → California town now requiring quiet paddles at public pickleball courts  Alex Lantz Director of Content Last Edited  Apr 10 2025  Pickleball players who play at Lang Park in Laguna Beach, California, will be required to use "quiet" paddles going forward after the city council there passed a law that fines people for using the louder traditional paddles.  The Police Department’s Park Rangers will enforce the new law, city officials said.  The city council took action after ed popularity. name: Pickleball Paradise
description:
Play is by court reservations only at $35 per hour.

2 Membership passes are available. The Pickle Pass at $99 per month includes: 5-1-hour court reservations for you and a guest, use of indoor clubhouse, Gatorade and snacks.

The Paradise Pass - $148 per month includes: 2/2hr court reservations and 2/1 hour court reservations plus use of the entire facility up to 2 hours for up to 3 guests, to include:  12 seat swim spa/Jacuzzi, private cabanas, frisbee golf, corn hole, putting green and volleyball.

Both memberships include 20% off of private event rentals, $5 off Round Robin admissions and an invitation for 2 to our annual 4th of July customer appreciation gala that features a live band, cocktails, dinner buffet and a raffle to win a variety of different prizes.  Not to mention the city of Lake Elsinore's amazing fireworks display from the lake!
